meanings.definition: Relating to the underlying structure or foundation of something.
meanings.sent1: The substructural beams supported the entire building.
meanings.sent2: The architect focused on the substructural design of the house.
meanings.sent3: The substructural strength of the bridge made it stand out among others.
meanings.sent4: Her substructural knowledge of the subject was the backbone of her success.
meanings.sent5: The substructural integrity of the dam prevented any leaks.

meanings.definition: Forming a part of the basic structure or framework.
meanings.sent1: The substructural elements were crucial for the stability of the project.
meanings.sent2: The team worked on the substructural aspects of the plan first.
meanings.sent3: The substructural pieces fit together like a puzzle.
meanings.sent4: His substructural role in the team was essential for progress.
meanings.sent5: The substructural framework provided a strong base for further development.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to the essential elements or components.
meanings.sent1: The substructural components were carefully assembled to ensure functionality.
meanings.sent2: The substructural details were critical for the project's success.
meanings.sent3: The substructural parts were like the heart of the machine.
meanings.sent4: Her substructural understanding of the process was unmatched.
meanings.sent5: The substructural elements formed the core of the invention.
